Dear Paris Marie Miller:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
1

checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility has not been conducting 15-minute interval checks.
Investigation Interviews:
On 09/26/2024 an unannounced visit was made to Havenwyck. A
request was made to review the bed check logs utilized by the
agency. The logs were found to not document 15-minute variable
interval checks of youth when outside of direct supervision.
On 09/26/2024 Chief Administrator was interviewed at
Havenwyck. She confirmed that the agency had failed to make
the adjustments to the bed check log as discussed at the last
unannounced visit. She further reported that the Risk Manager
was working on the revision to the form and failed to finalize it for
use by the staff.
On 09/26/2024 an onsite interview was completed with Risk
Manager. He advised that he has been working with the
management team to get the revised bed check log form
approved for use. He reported that the medical management
team has an upcoming meeting at which they will review and
provide a decision.
On 10/18/2024 an email was sent to Chief Administrator
requesting a copy of the updated Individual Precaution Check
Form (Round Sheet) that is being utilized to document the 15-
minute checks for youth in the program throughout the day and
copies of the relevant policy.
On 11/04/2024 an email request was sent to Chief Administrator
requesting a copy of the agency policy relevant to variable interval
checks.
Documents Reviewed:
Havenwyck Individual Precaution Check Form (Round Sheet)
The form was found to document youth checks throughout the day
but failed to complete them in variable intervals during time frames
when the youth were asleep or outside of the direct supervision of
staff.
Havenwyck Resident Observation Policy
2

Policy indicates that staff will document the youths location and
observation of the youths behavior. The documentation will be
documented within 15 minutes of the time stamp on the Individual
Precaution Check Form (Round Sheet). Staff must initial each 15-
minute time frame for which they were responsible for directly
observing the youth and must provide their signature on the form.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Review of documents
and interview with Chief Administrator confirmed that the agency
was not completing the bed checks as required by policy. In
addition, it was determined that the agency policy relevant to this
rule is incorrectly written and requires revision to be consistent
with licensing requirements.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
